FORWARD_DIGIT_INST:
FORWARD DIGIT SPAN

You will be presented with a sequence of digits, one at a time. Your task is to remember them and type them back IN THE SAME ORDER you saw them.

For example, if you see: 3 7 2 9
You should type: 3729
BACKWARD_DIGIT_INST:
BACKWARD DIGIT SPAN

You will be presented with a sequence of digits, one at a time. Your task is to remember them and type them back IN REVERSE ORDER.

For example, if you see: 3 7 2 9
You should type: 9273
FORWARD_LETTER_INST:
FORWARD LETTER SPAN

You will be presented with a sequence of letters, one at a time. Your task is to remember them and type them back IN THE SAME ORDER you saw them.

For example, if you see: K D B M
You should type: KDBM
BACKWARD_LETTER_INST:
BACKWARD LETTER SPAN

You will be presented with a sequence of letters, one at a time. Your task is to remember them and type them back IN REVERSE ORDER.

For example, if you see: K D B M
You should type: MBDK
FORWARD_MIXED_INST:
FORWARD MIXED SPAN

You will be presented with a mix of digits and letters, one at a time. Your task is to remember them and type them back IN THE SAME ORDER you saw them.

For example, if you see: 3 K 7 D
You should type: 3K7D
BACKWARD_MIXED_INST:
BACKWARD MIXED SPAN

You will be presented with a mix of digits and letters, one at a time. Your task is to remember them and type them back IN REVERSE ORDER.

For example, if you see: 3 K 7 D
You should type: D7K3
ORDERING_DIGIT_INST:
DIGIT ORDERING

You will be presented with digits one at a time. Your task is to remember them and type them back IN NUMERICAL ORDER from smallest to largest.

For example, if you see: 7, 2, 9, 3 (shown one at a time)
You should type: 2379
ORDERING_LETTER_INST:
LETTER ORDERING

You will be presented with letters one at a time. Your task is to remember them and type them back IN ALPHABETICAL ORDER.

For example, if you see: K, D, M, B (shown one at a time)
You should type: BDKM
ORDERING_MIXED_INST:
MIXED ORDERING

You will be presented with a mix of digits and letters one at a time. Your task is to remember them and type them back with DIGITS FIRST (in numerical order) followed by LETTERS (in alphabetical order).

For example, if you see: K, 7, D, 2, M, 9 (shown one at a time)
You should type: 279DKM
INSTSKIP: If you do not know what comes next, you can skip over it by typing the '-' key. Try to put items in their correct positions.
INSTNOSKIP: If you do not know what comes next, you must guess, but try to put items in their correct positions.
INSTBACK: If you make a mistake, you can use the backspace key to make a correction.
INSTNOBACK: Once you enter an item, you cannot go back to edit your responses.
LTH: You will start with a short list and work up to longer lists. If you correctly recall enough lists at a given length, you will move on to the next longest list.
HTL: You will start with a long list and work down to shorter lists. After your trials at each length, you will move down to the next shorter list unless you recall all lists correctly.
SCS: You will start with a medium-length list. If you recall it correctly, your next list will be one item longer; if incorrect, one item shorter. This will continue for several trials.
HEADER: Type your response (0-9, A-Z), press Enter when complete
ORDERING_HEADER: Type items in correct order, press Enter when complete
FORWARD_DIGIT_HEADER: Enter digits in same order shown
FORWARD_LETTER_HEADER: Enter letters in same order shown
ORDERING_DIGIT_HEADER: Enter digits in numerical order (low to high)
DEBRIEF:
Thank you for completing the Span Variants test.
